samples:
Then all of a sudden, they heard a loud crack! A glass was broken! One of the frogs picked up the broken pieces and saw it was their marriage glass.
The other frog said, "Oh no, our marriage glass is broken!"
The first frog thought carefully, and then said, "It doesn't matter - we can still marry. Now our marriage will be rough, but it will be just as beautiful as before."
The two frogs looked into each other’s eyes and kissed, and then together hopped away to their new home - together as husband and wife.

One day, the angel's dad said he would repair the toy car. The angel was very happy and enthusiastic. They went to the garage to fix the toy car.
The angel and dad worked together. They repaired the toy car. The angel was so happy to play with the toy car again. They had a fun day playing together.

Once upon a time, there was a pencil. The pencil was broken. It was sad because it could not draw.
One day, the broken pencil met a little girl. The girl saw the pencil and wanted to help it. She picked up the pencil and took it home. She put tape around the pencil to fix it.
The next day, the pencil became magic. It could draw anything the girl wanted. The girl and the pencil were very happy. They drew pictures all day long. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once there was a little boy named Jack. He was very happy and liked to clap his hands. One day, while staring at the wall, he noticed it was broken. So he clapped his hands enthusiastically.
Jack's mom heard the noise and asked, "What happened, Jack?"
Jack replied, "The wall is broken and I'm clapping my hands."
Mom looked at the wall and then at her son. She smiled and said, "Let's fix the wall together."

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy car that he loved very much. But one day, the toy car was broken. Tim was sad because he could not play with his favorite toy.
Tim's mom saw him crying and had an urge to help. She told Tim that it was important to value the things we have, even if they are broken. So, she gave him some glue and paper to fix the car. Tim was happy and excited to make his toy car work again.

the ground and it was broken. Tim felt sad for her and wanted to help. He walked over to the girl and said, "Don't cry, you can have my ice cream cone." The girl stopped crying and smiled.
Tim's mom saw what happened and was very proud of him. She hugged Tim and said, "I'm so proud of you for sharing your ice cream with the little girl. That was very kind." Tim felt happy that he could help someone else.
